alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 5:31PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Dale, northwestern Henry and east central Coffee Counties through 615 PM CST... At 531 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ariton, or 7 miles northwest of Ozark, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ozark, Fort Rucker, Ariton, Greater Salem Church, Skipperville, Dill, Edwin, Roberts Crossroads, Rocky Head, Arguta, Barefield Crossroads, Beamon, Dale County Lake, Clopton, Marley Hill, Dillard, Phillips Crossroads, Dykes Crossroads and Hooper Stage Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
